meanings.sent1: She dimmed the lights in the room to create a cozy atmosphere.
meanings.sent2: The sunset dimmed slowly as the night approached.
meanings.sent3: The magician dimmed the stage lights to add mystery to his performance.
meanings.sent4: His enthusiasm dimmed as the reality of the situation sank in.
meanings.sent5: The stars dimmed the city lights with their natural brilliance.

meanings.sent1: The storm dimmed in strength as it moved away from the coast.
meanings.sent2: His anger dimmed once he understood the situation better.
meanings.sent3: The excitement dimmed as the event got postponed.
meanings.sent4: Her voice dimmed with sadness as she spoke about her loss.
meanings.sent5: The music dimmed in volume, creating a soothing background ambiance.

meanings.definition: Make or become less clear or distinct
meanings.sent1: The fog dimmed the view of the mountains in the distance.
meanings.sent2: His memory of the event dimmed over time.
meanings.sent3: The ink on the paper dimmed, making the text hard to read.
meanings.sent4: The details of the story dimmed as the plot thickened.
meanings.sent5: The colors dimmed together, creating a blurred painting effect.
